intro: Cotoneaster zaprjagaevae, commonly known as the Zaprjagaev's cotoneaster, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in countries like Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan. This shrub typically grows at high altitudes, often in rocky or semi-arid environments. Its small, red berries are an important food source for local wildlife. The plant is characterized by its dense foliage and ability to thrive in harsh climatic conditions.
